comments:
Build: 20020328

I had one plugin fragment in my workspace when I used the plugin import tool.
When I got to the "Selection" stage of the import wizard I got an error dialog
that said "44 >= 1".  All I could do was click ok.

Then there was an extra, blank, entry at the top of the list.  I checked it and
clicked "Add Required Plug-ins".  I got the following walkback.

Could you describe your scenario in more detail? I would like to be able to 
reproduce it (it may be related to the fact that you have a fragment in the 
workspace).

Ah-ha.  Upon further examination, I had a plugin fragment in my host eclipse
with the same name as the plugin fragment I was creating.  

Follow these steps:

1. New workspace
2. In the "Target Platform" preferences, select all non-workspace plugins.
3. Create a plugin fragment named "test".  In the creation wizard, make test a
fragment of Eclipse Workbench.  With a "Compatible" match rule.
4. Export test to the filesystem in /<eclipse install>/fragments
5. Restart Eclipse
6. Use the plugin import wizard to import plugins.  Then the above occured.

A trivial problem - fragments were iterated over using the plug-in counter. 
Fixed and released into HEAD (will appear in the next integration build).
